trait.name: Lucky Footwork
entries: Ches can add 2 ({@damage 1d4}) when making a Dexterity saving throw.

trait.name: Hare Trigger
entries: Ches gains a {@b +3} bonus to initiative.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Ches can take one additional action on their turn.

trait.name: Arcane Shot (2/Short Rest)
entries: Ches can apply an Arcane Shot Option to an arrow when they make a ranged weapon attack

items.name: {@b Piercing Arrow}
items.entry: The shot goes passes through a 30 foot long line and creatures in it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage or half as much on a successful save.

items.name: {@b Blinding Shot}
items.entry: The shot does an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of Ches's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ches makes two attacks.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw, rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@i Hit:} 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Ches can regain 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) HP.

bonus.name: Rabbit Hop (3/Long Rest)
entries: Ches can jump 15 ft. without provoking opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Soul of the Talisman
immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
languages: Common plus up to two other languages

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Ta-lich-man fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the {@i {@b Talisman}} is not destroyed, the Ta-lich-man gains a new body in 5 ({@damage 1d10}) days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the {@i {@b talisman}}.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The Ta-lich-man has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Grave Touched (1/Turn)
entries: Once during each of their turns, when the Ta-lich-man hits a creature with an attack roll, they can replace the damage type with necrotic damage. While using {@b {@i Form of Dread}}, the Ta-lich-man can roll one additional damage die of necrotic damage.

trait.name: Pact of the Talisman (6/Long Rest)
entries: While wearing the amulet, when the Ta-lich-man fails an ability check or saving throw, it can add a 2 ({@damage 1d4}) to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The Ta-lich-man doesn't need to eat, drink, or breathe.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ta-lich-man is an 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@i Melee Spell Attack:} 12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@i Hit:} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} 18 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Spirit Projection (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: The Ta-lich-man can project its spirit from their body. The body left behind is {@condition unconscious} and in a state of suspended animation. Any damage or other effects that apply to its spirit or physical body affects the other. While projecting its spirit, the Ta-lich-man gains the following benefits:

items: Both spirit and body gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
When casting a spell of the conjuration or necromancy school, the spell doesn't require verbal or somatic components or material components that lack a gold cost.

The Ta-lich-man has a flying speed of 30 ft. walking speed and can hover. It can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, but takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside a creature or an object.
While using its {@i {@b Form of Dread}}, once during each of its turns when dealing necrotic damage, the Ta-lich-man regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

entries: The Ta-lich-man's spirit can remain outside its body for up to 1 hour or until concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). When this projection ends, this spirit returns to the body or the body magically teleports to the spirit's space (your choice).

bonus.name: Form of Dread (6/Long Rest)
entries: The Ta-lich-man manifests an aspect of their patron's dreadful power, transforming for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits:

items: The Ta-lich-man gains temporary hit points equal to 25 ({@damage 1d10 + 20}).
The Ta-lich-man becomes immune to necrotic damage

Once during each of their turns, when Ta-lich-man hit a creature with an attack roll, they can force it to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, or be {@condition frightened} of the Ta-lich-man until the end of it's next turn.
The Ta-lich-man is immune to the frightened condition.

entries: The Ta-lich-man's {@b {@i Form of Dread}} appears as a shroud of shadows masking eyes emanating incomprehensible whispers.

reaction.name: Necrotic Husk (Rechages after 1d4 Long Rests)
entries: When the Ta-lich-man would be reduced to 0 hit points, it can drop to 1 hit point instead and cause its body to erupt with deathly energy. Each creature of their choice, within 30 feet of it takes 31 ({@damage 2d10 + 20}) necrotic damage. The Ta-lich-man gains 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

legendaryHeader: The lich can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The lich regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The Ta-lich-man casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Ta-lich-man uses its {@i {@b Paralyzing Touch}}.

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the lich's gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each non-undead creature within 20 feet of the Ta-lich-man must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 21 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
